title: Blended Learning Environment Design in Business Administration: Flipped Learning-Based Social Science Approach Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational business administration theories (organizational behavior, marketing, financial management) and basic instructional design principles, with foundational knowledge in social science analysis (culture, institutions, relationships)
context.additional_context: A practical instructional design competency development program for pre-service and in-service teachers, focusing on designing curricula that consider the social impact of business education (corporate citizenship, sustainability) and educational effectiveness (learning outcomes, engagement).

learning_goals: Propose at least three design frameworks incorporating socioscientific analyses (organization, institutions, relationships) for applying a flipped learning-based blended model to business administration education.

During the mid-term graduate course (2â€“4 weeks), learners create an integrated design map linking online pre-learning materials (videos, readings) with offline activities (discussions, workshops) and present three specific strategies aligned with business education goals (leadership, decision-making, resource management). These strategies must achieve an 80%+ suitability score via peer evaluation.
Design at least two formative assessments that promote learner engagement through interactive elements (feedback, collaboration, critical thinking).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
